title: Frequency and period - pendula - different planets

content.question: A pendulum has a period of <math alttext="T sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></math> on Earth, where the acceleration due to gravity is <math alttext="g sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></math>. On a distant planet, where the acceleration due to gravity is <math alttext="g sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></math>, an identical pendulum has a period of <math alttext="2 T sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>. What is <math alttext="g sub P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub></math> in terms of <math alttext="g sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="one fourth g sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="one half g sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="2 g sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="4 g sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one fourth g sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>g</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
